avalancheActivity.comment: Forecast Snow Stability: Currently there is insufficient snow cover to present any avalanche hazard and avalanche reports will not be issued for this area. Go to the Blogs and Mountain info for area photos; area info will be provided by SAIS forecasters on a daily basis.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Forecast Weather Influences: Strong increasing very strong, generally Westerly winds. During the evening the freezing level will drop to around 750 metres where it will remain through the day. Showers, falling as snow above around 700 metres, during the period.
Observed Weather Influences: Strong generally South-Westerly winds, with light rain at all levels.
ObservedSnowStability: Currently there is insufficient snow cover to present any avalanche hazard and avalanche reports will not be issued for this area. Go to the Blogs and Mountain info for area photos; area info will be provided by SAIS forecasters on a daily basis.

avalancheActivity.comment: Forecast Snow Stability: New accumulations of light snow deposits are not expected to be significant, these will fall onto moist bare ground and should not present an avalanche hazard. Greatest accumulations will be on North-East to South-East aspects above 800 metres.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Forecast Weather Influences: Tonight colder conditions, a showery West to North-West flow will become established and the freezing level will be around 800 metres. Showers will fall as snow mainly above 650 metres with severe gale or storm force Westerly winds, gusts reaching 60 to 70 mph.
Observed Weather Influences: Today the rain eased by mid morning, this was falling at all elevations in the continuing mild conditions. The summit temperatures were around plus 6 degrees celsius this morning and slowly lowered to 2.7 degrees by midday and the winds were South-Westerly fresh to strong.
ObservedSnowStability: Currently there is insufficient snow cover to present any avalanche hazard and an avalanche report will not be issued for this area today. Go to the Blogs and Mountain info for area photos; area info will be provided by SAIS forecasters on a daily basis.

avalancheActivity.comment: Forecast Snow Stability: The patchy snow cover will become firmer with new isolated accumulations developing in a few steeper, wind sheltered locations mainly on North-East to South-East aspects above 900 metres. Corrie rims and sheltered terrain will be most affected but new deposits are not expected to become significant. Elsewhere, there will be a dusting of snow on bare ground.  The avalanche hazard will be Low.
avalancheActivity.highlights: SC 19.12.23 Shallow deposits developing sheltered NE to SE aspects above 900m. Dusting elsewhere. Avalanche hazard Low.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Forecast Weather Influences: Becoming cooler with light snow showers expected during the day above 700 metres. Winds will strengthen and veer during the morning, strong West-North-Westerlies during the afternoon.
Observed Weather Influences: Mild with the freezing level above the summits. Isolated rain showers at times. Winds were strong from the South-West.
ObservedSnowStability: The patchy snow cover is moist and well bonded. Greatest amounts are found above 900 metres mainly in North to East facing corries and on the highest plateau areas. The avalanche hazard is Low.

avalancheActivity.comment: Forecast Snow Stability: Currently there is insufficient snow cover to present any avalanche hazard and avalanche reports will not be issued for this area. Go to the Blogs and Mountain info for area photos and area info will be provided by SAIS forecasters on a daily basis.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Forecast Weather Influences: Cooler and windy. Some light snow, but nothing significant expected.
Observed Weather Influences: 
ObservedSnowStability: Currently there is insufficient snow cover to present any avalanche hazard and avalanche reports will not be issued for this area. Go to the Blogs and Mountain info for area photos and area info will be provided by SAIS forecasters on a daily basis.

avalancheActivity.comment: Forecast Snow Stability: Isolated accumulations of windslab will be deposited on very steep, wind sheltered North-West through North to South-East aspects above 1100 metres. Coire rims and gully tops will only be affected where moderately bonded accumulations overlie the existing snowpack or achieve depth. Outwith these areas a light dusting of snow will cover bare ground. Cornices will develop around coire rims. The avalanche hazard will be Low.
avalancheActivity.highlights: NC for 19.12. Isolated windslab deposited NW,N,NE and SE aspects above 1100 metres. Dusting over bare ground. Avalanche Hazard Low.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Forecast Weather Influences: After a dry night, precipitation is expected to fall as snow above 700 metres for the duration of the day. The freezing level will fall in the first part of the night, to be around 800 metres for most of the day. Winds will generally be from the West, gale force increasing to storm force by dawn.
Observed Weather Influences: Occasional showers fell as rain at all elevations for most of the day. Winds were strong to gale force, and from the West-South-West. The freezing level remained above the highest summits for the duration of the day.
ObservedSnowStability: The snowpack is generally well bonded, stable and continues to thaw at all elevations. Snow patches are generally found above 1100 metres around coire back walls and plateau areas, with just isolated ribbons above 750 metres. Remnants of cornices are still visible above North-West to North-East aspects. The avalanche hazard is Low.

avalancheActivity.comment: Forecast Snow Stability: Currently there is insufficient snow cover to present any avalanche hazard, therefore avalanche reports will not be issued for this area. Refer to the Torridon Blog and Mountain Information for details which will be provided by SAIS forecasters on a daily basis.
avalancheActivity.highlights: TO for 19/12. Currently insufficient snow cover to present any avalanche hazard, therefore no avalanche report will be issued.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Forecast Weather Influences: There will be gale force Westerly winds and showers, falling as snow above around 700 metres. The freezing level will be around 800 metres.
Observed Weather Influences: It was a mild day with strong West-South-West winds and showers falling as rain at all elevations.
ObservedSnowStability: Currently there is insufficient snow cover to present any avalanche hazard, therefore avalanche reports will not be issued for this area. Refer to the Torridon Blog and Mountain Information for details which will be provided by SAIS forecasters on a daily basis.
